page.title: 11FOOD
page.content: We have about three or four meals a day. We have breakfast, dinner, tea and sometimes supper. For breakfast we have toast, which is bread grilled. We have that about 8 a.m.. The traditional English breakfast is bacon and eggs. For lunch (or dinner) on a weekday we take sandwiches to school. Sandwiches are pieces of bread with a filling of perhaps meat or egg. At weekends we might have a cooked dinner of beef or pork, peas, potatoes, Yorkshire pudding and gravy. Some days we have fish and chips. You make chips like this: you have potatoes, peel all the skin off, cut them into strips, put them into deep frier, wait till they are brown and then take them out and eat them. For tea we might have ham or another meat, lettuce and tomatoes. To drink we have tea, coffee or squash.
